dogecoin.text:
@OurielOhayon @Tylerban We need 'Venmo for Dogecoin'. Not just a wallet, but also an easy way to split bills and request money from friends, ideally with a fun timeline and a social graph.

Most importantly, we need people to think about prices in DOGE rather than USD. Dogecoin *is* money.
@heisgreatchmz @OurielOhayon @Tylerban Agreed. You could actually OP_RETURN a social network into Dogecoin, i.e. use Dogecoin as a DNS.
@OurielOhayon @Tylerban True. I'm not denying that Dogecoin also has a Dogital Gold usecase. Nevertheless, it's not weaker than Bitcoin as a method of payment.

@OurielOhayon @Tylerban When you're investing you have to work with imperfect information. I showed you data from bitpay, the #1 crypto payment gateway. Coinbase is #2, and Dogecoin is one of only 6 payment methods they support (not all listed assets are accepted for merchant payments).
@OurielOhayon @Tylerban You can do your own research, I'm not sure this exact aggregation is available. I did present evidence that Dogecoin is used to pay for things.
@OurielOhayon @Tylerban See this. Dogecoin is superior over Bitcoin when you look at [payments market share]/[market cap]

@OurielOhayon @Tylerban BTC is used for 57%, Dogecoin is used for 10% of payments on bitpay. So Bitcoin's market cap is disproportionately high relative to usage as a payment method.

https://t.co/7kgYfvaimb
@OurielOhayon @Tylerban The hard data is that 95% use Dogecoin when using crypto to check out with Dallas Mavericks
@OurielOhayon @Tylerban BitPay, Coinbase and many others integrate Dogecoin.
@Tylerban @OurielOhayon Ah, this again. Elon and Mark have enough money, this is not why they promote Dogecoin. Also it does not change the fact that customers use Dogecoin to pay.

@Tylerban @OurielOhayon Dogecoin was started as a joke, it's not designed to acquire more Bitcoin. Dogecoin has low transaction fees, great liquidity, reasonable block size and low latency. Most importantly, people use it to pay for things.
